meta.name: description
meta.content: South Lane School District has 7 schools that caters to PK-12th grade in Cottage Grove, OR.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: South Lane School District, Cottage Grove Oregon SLSD, CG, School, public education, public school, South lane

div.div:
Our food service and transportation workers have added stops for mobile meal stops.
Any child, ages 0-18 is eligible for a daily 'grab & go' breakfast and lunch from any of the sites listed below. Due to a federal regulation change, children DO NOT need to be present to pick up a meal.
These meals will continue every weekday through the state-mandated closure. CGHS 9:00-10:00 London 9:00-10:30 Dorena 9:00-10:30 Dorena Post Office: 10:40-11:00
Bus stops: 8th & Wilson 8:55 8th & Arthur 9:00 948 S. 6th St. 9:00 Harrison & 10th 9:10 Bohemia Park 9:15 700 E. Gibbs Ave. 9:20 16th & Gibbs 9:22 16th & Pritchett 9:25 Riverside Apartments 9:30 16th & Ostrander 9:30 22nd & E. Whiteaker 9:40 Frontier Trailer Park 9:40 Goodwill/Dollar Tree Lot 9:45 2424 Whiteaker Ave. 9:50 Holly & River Rd. 9:50 Birch Ave & J St. 10:00 Faith Center (Row River Rd.) 10:05 Bohemia Elementary 10:10 125 Gateway Blvd. 10:20 5th St. near Madison 10:25 2nd & Quincy 10:30 2nd & River Walk Place 10:40 11th St. & Lord 10:40 2nd & Tyler 10:45 Saginaw Trailer Park 11:00 Rachel Rd. near gravel area 11:03 Harrison Elementary 11:45

img.alt: Apply for the Budget Committee Featured Photo

div.div: South Lane SD is accepting applications to fill two open seats on its volunteer budget committee.

Dear Students and Parents,
Today Governor Brown closed in-person classes for the rest of the school year. This means that students will not be returning to our school buildings for the remainder of this school year. She said, “the best thing we can do for the health of our children, and for the thousands of educators across the state, is to give everyone certainty by announcing the decision today to close in-person classes for the remainder of the school year.”

Today Governor Kate Brown announced she is extending Oregon’s physical school closures for the K-12 education systems through the end of the current school year. She directed school districts to complete the final weeks of the academic year by continuing distance education and support to students. We will begin our distance education on Monday, April 13. If your student has not already done so please have them check their email and sign into the google classroom for each of their teachers. We understand we have families without connectivity and we will provide student work for those families.

h3.a: All SLSD School Closed through April 28th

img.alt: All SLSD School Closed through April 28th Featured Photo

div.div:
The state of Oregon has closed all schools, including South Lane schools, to close through April 28th in response to the impact of the novel coronavirus situation. South Lane School District, its teachers, staff and administration are working to develop a method to deliver a quality education experience in such a trying time. Your child's school will be in touch with you shortly.
For children, 0-18 years old, grab and go breakfasts and lunches will continue to at these locations and bus stops. Children do not need to be present for a meal to be picked up:
Schools: CGHS 9-10am London 9-10am Dorena 9-10am
Bus stops: 8th & Arthur 9:00 Bohemia Park 9:15 16th & Pritchett 9:25 new 16th & Ostrander 9:30 new 22nd & E. Whiteaker 9:40 2424 Whiteaker Ave. 9:50 new Faith Ctr. on Row River 10:05 new 125 Gateway Blvd. 10:20 11th St. & Lord 10:40 Saginaw Trailer Park 11:00
Bus stops: 948 S 6th St. 9:00 Harrison & 10th 9:10 new 700 E. Gibbs Ave. 9:20 Frontier Trailer Park 9:40 new Goodwill/Dollar Tree lot 9:40 Holly & River Rd. 9:50 new Birch Ave & J St. 10:00 Bohemia Elementary 10:10 new 5th St. near Madison 10:25 River Walk Place 10:40
